General education sector,Sub-national government administration,Roads and highways,General water, sanitation and flood
            protection sector,Banking

abstracts.cdata!:
Project outcome is rated unsatisfactory:
            While the publicity generated from the preparation/launch of
            the project and the training events led by the Municipal
            Development Agency (MDA) did have some positive impact,
            there is little firm evidence that the project fulfilled the
            objective of creating and maintaining a pipeline of bankable
            municipal infrastructure projects. Project sustainability is
            rated likely. Overall, World Bank performance is rated
            satisfactory, as is Borrower performance, based on the
            performance of the two participating banks and the
            Government during preparation and of the banks during
            implementation. Lessons learned included the following: The
            state of Poland's economy changed, pertinent laws and
            regulation changed, and the banking/municipal sectors
            changed. The availability of more flexible lending
            instruments and more flexibility to switch from one
            instrument to another could have enabled the Bank and the
            Borrower to react more quickly to changing circumstances.
            Although desirable from a developmental point of view,
            requiring the banks to enter into complex cost recovery
            computations or conditionality and require full cost
            recovery was not workable in an environment where full cost
            recovery for wastewater investments is currently rarely
            achieved. Also, a commercial bank line of credit was an
            inappropriate mechanism for requiring procurement procedures
            that differed from those of the procurement law.
